fg-alert.heading: You need to have a job or pension to continue
fg-alert.p: To continue using the estimator, you need to have at least one job or pension that regularly withholds federal income taxes. If you don’t pay any taxes on your income through withholding, you may want to plan to pay estimated taxes. (opens in a new tab)

fg-set.question: Who is this income for?
Do you expect to have this job all year, from January 1 - December 31, 2025?
What’s the start date?
What’s the end date?
When did your most recent pay period end?
When was your most recent pay date?
How steady is the pay from paycheck to paycheck?

input.option: The pay is about the same each paycheck
The pay is very different each paycheck

fg-set.question: What is the income made on your last paycheck?
What is the income made on your most recent paycheck?
What is the income made on your second-most recent paycheck?
What is the income made on your third-most recent paycheck? Leave this blank if you only have two past paychecks.

What retirement plan contributions do you make per pay period for this job?

How much qualified tips did you make for this job?

What is the rate at which you get paid overtime?

What’s the end date?

What’s the average amount you get paid each pay period?
What’s your year-to-date income for this pension?
What’s the average amount of federal withholding each pay period?
What’s your year-to-date federal withholding for this pension?
How frequently are you paid?

fg-section-gate.heading: Social Security details
fg-section-gate.content: Once we know more about your income, we’ll ask you additional questions.

fg-collection.p: Use the most recent Social Security statement to enter the following information.

fg-set.question: What’s the total amount of Social Security benefits youyou or your spouse receive each month?

fg-collection.p: Use the most recent Social Security statement to enter the following information.

fg-set.question: How much federal tax has been withheld (paid) for this Social Security payment?
fg-set.hint: Don’t include state and local taxes or Medicare.

p.modal-link: Where do I find federal taxes per pay period?

fg-set.question: How much federal tax has been withheld (paid) year-to-date?
fg-set.hint: Don’t include state and local taxes or Medicare.

p.modal-link: Where do I find federal taxes year-to-date?

fg-set.question: Distributions from Trump Account
How much was your gross self-employment income this year?
How much was your self-employment expenses this year?
How much was your spouses' gross self-employment income this year?
How much was your spouses' self-employment expenses this year?
How much have you made in ordinary dividends income so far this year?
How much qualified dividends income do you estimate for this year?
How much long-term capital gains income do you estimate for this year?
How much have you received in employment insurance income so far this year?
How much other income have you made this year?
How much non-taxable interest income have you received this year?
How much short term capital gains have you received this year?
How much taxable scholarship income have you received this year?
How much alimony (pre-2019 divorce) have you received this year?
How much S-corp non-passive income (Schedule K1) have you made this year?
How much Net Schedule E income from passive activities have you received this year?
How much rental income have you made this year?
How much royalty income have you made this year?
How much non-specific other income have you made this year?

section.h2: SSA income from Forms SSA-1099 and RRB-1099

fg-set.question: If you [and your spouse] made any estimated tax payments this year, you may deduct those. This does not include taxes withheld from your paycheck .

modal-dialog.modal-heading: What counts as Social Security income?

modal-content.p: Social security is benefit payments made to retirees, people with disabilities, and their families through the Social Security Administration (SSA). To report this income at the end of the year, the SSA sends Form SSA-1099.
Don’t include Supplemental Security Income (SSI) payments. The estimator doesn’t currently support SSI payments.

modal-dialog.modal-heading: Where do I find federal taxes per pay period?

modal-content.p: These are amounts withheld, or taken out of a Social Security payment to pay for federal taxes throughout the year.
Where to find the federal taxes paid per pay period:

ul.li: Log in to your “my Social Security” account to review your Social Security payments and check for the federal taxes paid for each payment (if you elected to withhold federal taxes).
You can also call the Social Security Administration at 1-800-772-1213 to request your federal tax withholding amount.

modal-content.p: Don’t include state taxes, local taxes, Medicare, or other amounts withheld.

modal-dialog.modal-heading: Where do I find federal taxes year-to-date?

modal-content.p: These are amounts withheld, or taken out of a Social Security payment to pay for federal taxes throughout the year.
Where to find the federal taxes paid year-to-date:

ul.li: Log in to your “my Social Security” account to review your Social Security payments and check for the federal taxes paid so far for the year (if you elected to withhold federal taxes).
You can also call the Social Security Administration at 1-800-772-1213 to request your federal tax withholding amount.

modal-content.p: Don’t include state taxes, local taxes, Medicare, or other amounts withheld.
